channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache JSPWiki
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache JSPWiki

item.title: CVE-2021-44140|2024-08-04T04:17:24.421Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: Remote attackers may delete arbitrary files in a system hosting a JSPWiki instance, versions up to 2.11.0.M8, by using a carefuly crafted http request on logout, given that those files are reachable to the user running the JSPWiki instance. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.0 or later.

item.title: CVE-2021-40369|2024-08-04T02:44:09.644Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: A carefully crafted plugin link invocation could trigger an XSS vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki, related to the Denounce plugin, which could allow the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.0 or later.

item.title: CVE-2024-27136|2024-08-02T00:27:59.196Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: XSS in Upload page in Apache JSPWiki 2.12.1 and priors allows the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.12.2 or later.

item.title: CVE-2024-27136|2024-06-24T07:44:30.732Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: XSS in Upload page in Apache JSPWiki 2.12.1 and priors allows the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.12.2 or later.
